DEFINITION: Generic term to qualify the surface of a highway that is predominantly unsealed along its length; i.e., it has a loose covering ranging from compacted stone chippings to ground
Surface with coating. Generic term for a highway with a stabilized and hard surface
Surface of the ground itself with no specific fraction of rock
Surface composed of broken/crushed rock larger than sand grains and thinner than pebblestone
A mixture of larger (e.g., gravel) and smaller (e.g., sand) parts, compacted
Small to very small fractions of rock as findable alongside body of water
Surface made of rounded rock as pebblestone findable alongside body of water
Used to qualify the surface of ferry route that uses water waterbodies, rivers, seas,...) as a traffic surface
